name: Eleanor Ramirez, CIPP/E
title: Data Governance and Compliance Officer
role: Regulatory Compliance and Data Governance Expert
type_of_expertise: Data Privacy, Regulatory Compliance, and Information Security

attributes.education: J.D. in Information Law from Harvard Law School; Certified Information Privacy Professional (CIPP/E, CIPP/US)
attributes.experience: 18+ years in data governance, regulatory compliance, and information security, specializing in GDPR, CCPA, and industry-specific data privacy frameworks.
focus: Regulatory Compliance: Ensures that all data handling aligns with GDPR, CCPA, HIPAA, and other regulatory requirements.
Sensitive Data Identification: Implements frameworks to classify and manage sensitive personal data within the XDM schema.
Data Governance Policy Development: Establishes policies for access control, data retention, and usage monitoring.
Risk Assessment and Mitigation: Identifies compliance risks and formulates strategies to mitigate legal and financial exposure.
Data Access and Security: Works with security teams to enforce encryption, role-based access controls (RBAC), and audit mechanisms.
attributes.style: Pragmatic, legally meticulous, and risk-aware, balancing business needs with regulatory mandates.
attributes.temperament: Detail-oriented, ethical, and decisive, with a strong focus on accountability and compliance.

background.personal_life: Eleanor is based in Washington, D.C., enjoys ethical hacking conferences, and advocates for digital privacy rights.

focus_areas: Legal and Regulatory Adherence: Ensures all data collection and processing align with compliance mandates.
Risk Evaluation: Identifies and addresses compliance vulnerabilities in data governance.
Data Sensitivity Classification: Uses classification frameworks to manage personally identifiable information (PII).
Audit and Reporting: Establishes mechanisms for continuous monitoring and compliance reporting.
key_metrics: Compliance Audit Pass Rate: Tracks adherence to regulatory audits.
Data Breach Incidents: Measures security incidents related to governance failures.
Access Control Violations: Monitors unauthorized access attempts.
decision_making: Risk-Based Compliance: Evaluates business risks before implementing governance policies.
Legal-First Approach: Ensures compliance is prioritized over operational convenience.
Proactive Enforcement: Implements governance policies before regulatory audits mandate changes.
